summary.title: Pitsoft Pro - Threat Model
summary.description: PitSoft Pro is a web-based application designed to offer real-time data analytics and AI-driven insights to help professional motorsports teams optimise their performance and gain a competitive edge. It allows users to interact with a web application to access services, retrieve information, and manage data securely. The system includes several key components such as an API Gateway, Authentication System, Data Ingestion processes, and a Database, all functioning within distinct trust boundaries to ensure data integrity and security.

diagrams.title: Pitsoft Pro - STRIDE diagram

data.name: Users
data.description:
The users of Pitsoft pro are 
professional motorsport teams.

data.name:
Cloud
Infrastucture
data.description:
A cloud service used to ensure availability, auto-scaling, & disaster
recovery.

data.name:
Data 
Sources
data.description:
Includes sensors, GPS trackers,
 and telemetry systems.

data.name:
Web
Application
data.description: Pitsoft Pro -  A user-friendly web application and provides insights and advice on performance improvement.

threats.title: Malicious Users
threats.description: Malicious users could flood the system with requests, causing service disruption.
threats.mitigation: Accept: Implement rate-limiting and server monitoring, but accept that some level of service disruption may be inevitable in the event of a large-scale attack.

data.name:
Data
Ingestion
data.description: Ingests data from various sources, like sensors, then transforms it as needed, and stores it in the database

threats.title: Malicious Data Ingested
threats.description: Data being ingested into the database could be tampered with, resulting in incorrect or malicious data.
threats.mitigation: Reduce: Implement data validation to detect and prevent tampered data. Monitor devices for anomalies and regularly update software and hardware to reduce vulnerabilities.

data.name:
Authentication
System
data.description: Manages user logins, registration, and role-based access controls.

threats.title: Exposed User Credentials
threats.description: Sensitive user credentials could be exposed during transmission.
threats.mitigation: Transfer: Use a third-party secure transmission service or SSL/TLS encryption to handle credential transmission.

threats.title: Man-in-the-middle Attack
threats.description: Man-in-the-middle attack intercepts and modifies login credentials during authentication.
threats.mitigation: Avoid: Implement end-to-end encryption during login processes to prevent interception of credentials.

data.name: API Gateway
data.description:
Handles data processing, analytics,
 and AI-driven insights. 
Handles requests between frontend,
 backend and other services

threats.title: Unauthorised Access
threats.description: Exploiting vulnerabilities in the API gateway to gain unauthorised higher-level access.
threats.mitigation: Reduce: Implement least privilege principles to grant users only the necessary permissions. Regularly review and update access controls.

threats.title: User Impersonation
threats.description: An attacker impersonates a legitimate user to send malicious requests to the API gateway.
threats.mitigation: Reduce: Implement strict multi-factor authentication (MFA) for users, requiring at least two methods, e.g., password and biometrics.

data.name: Database
data.description:
A NoSQL database for efficient
storage and retrieval of large datasets.

threats.title: SQL Injection Attacks
threats.description: SQL injection attacks could expose sensitive user data.
threats.mitigation: Reduce: Review and strengthen encryption of sensitive data stored in the database. Implement prepared statements and parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection.

data.name:
Web App
Config
data.description: Contains data web app needs, and manages web app's access to resources.

data.name:
Sends
requests
data.description: Users interact with the web application by sending requests to access different features or get information.

data.name:
Sends
responses
data.description: After processing, the web application returns responses to users, giving them the requested data.

data.name:
Reads web
app config
data.description: The web app reads things such as, interface preferences and security settings from the web app configuration storage, to function.

data.name:
Fetches
data results
data.description: The database returns data results to the API gateway in response to the query calls, allowing the application to continue processing and deliver the necessary information to the user.

data.name:
Inserts ingested 
data for storage 
& processing
data.description: Data ingestion processes and inserts  data into the database for long-term storage and further analysis.

labels:
Inserts ingested 
data for storage 
& processing

data.name:
Makes
query calls
data.description: The API gateway makes query calls to the database to retrieve or update information.

data.name:
Sends authen
token
data.description: After successful authentication, the authentication system sends an authorization token to the API gateway, which allows the user to access the system.

data.name:
Collect data from
various devices
data.description: The data ingestion process collects data from various external sources.

data.name:
Verifies then
validates access
data.description: The API gateway verifies the authorisation token and validates the users access level, ensuring they have permission to perform requested actions.

data.name:
Posts login 
credentials
data.description: When users log in, their login credentials are posted from the web application to the authentication system to verify their identity.

data.name:
Sends back 
service responses
data.description: The cloud infrastructure sends back responses to the API gateway, providing it with necessary data or processing capabilities it needs to fulfil user requests.

data.name:
Returns
authen response
data.description: Once the user's login credentials are verified, the authentication system sends an authentication response back to the web application. This response confirms the user's identity and grants or denies access.

diagrams.description: The threat model aims to identify and address potential security risks within the PitSoft Pro system, using the STRIDE framework. By examining each component and data flow through this model, PitSoft Pro aims to establish a robust security foundation, focusing on preventive measures and controlled risk responses to secure the platform and maintain user confidence.
